content.question: The reaction between aqueous strontium chloride <math alttext="Open parenthesis, S r C l 2, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>(SrCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and aqueous potassium sulfate <math alttext="Open parenthesis, K 2 S O 4, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>K</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> forms a precipitate of strontium sulfate <math alttext="Open parenthesis, S r S O 4, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>SrSO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following represents the net ionic equation for the reaction?

choices.label: <math alttext="C l, with a negative one charge, aqueous, plus, K with a positive one charge, aqueous, react to produce K C l, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>K</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mtext>KCl </mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="S r with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, plus, S O 4 with a negative 2 charge, aqueous, react to produce S r S O 4, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Sr</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>SrSO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="S r with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, plus, 2 C l with a negative one charge, aqueous, plus, S O 4 with a negative 2 charge, aqueous, plus, 2 K with a positive one charge, aqueous, react to produce, S r S O 4, solid, plus, 2 C l with a negative one charge, aqueous, plus, 2 K with a positive one charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Sr</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>K</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>SrSO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="S r C l 2, aqueous, plus, K 2 S O 4, aqueous, react to produce, S r S O 4, solid, plus, 2 K C l, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>SrCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>K</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>SrSO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext></mtext><mtext>KCl</mtext><mtext></mtext><mtext></mtext><mtext></mtext><mtext></mtext><mtext></mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="S r with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, plus, S O 4 with a negative 2 charge, aqueous, react to produce S r S O 4, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Sr</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>SrSO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.E: Determine a balanced chemical equation for a given chemical phenomenon.
